definition: to offer advice/to make a suggestion
to offer/to present/to dedicate/to donate/to show/to put on display/worthy person (old)
surname Ce
variant of 策[ce4]

policy/plan/scheme/bamboo slip for writing (old)/to whip (a horse)/to encourage/riding crop with sharp spines (old)/essay written for the imperial examinations (old)/upward horizontal stroke in calligraphy
variant of 策[ce4]

sentences.english: We brainstormed for most of the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 下午的大部分时间我们都在开献策攻关会。

sentences.english: I had a private audience with the King, and made a proposition.
sentences.chinese: 我私下朝见国王，向他陈言献策。

sentences.english: She was never behind in offering advice.
sentences.chinese: 她在出谏言献策方面从不落于人后。

sentences.english: They contribute to business strategy, and they transform that strategy through technology.
sentences.chinese: 他们为业务战略献计献策，通过技术改变这个战略。

sentences.english: Various media to the new Chairman, Mr Guo "suggestions".
sentences.chinese: 各路媒体纷纷向新任主席郭树清“建言献策”。

sentences.english: To enable students to broaden their horizons, for the company's long-term development suggestions.
sentences.chinese: 使学员开拓视野，为公司的长远发展献计献策。

sentences.english: Vote on the traffickers , the masses have a lot of wisdom to offer advice and suggestions.
sentences.chinese: 就票贩子的情况，群众也有无穷的智慧来献计献策。
他为这个计划献计献策。

sentences.english: Provide advice to Department manager to manage their teams.
sentences.chinese: 就团队管理事宜为各部门经理建言献策。

sentences.english: Kim hoped that people from all walks of life would, through the forum, produce good ideas for the prosperity of Asia.
sentences.chinese: 他希望各界人士能通过论坛为亚洲的繁荣献计献策。

definition: to offer advice/to make a suggestion
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
to make a suggestion/to state (one's views, ideas etc)/suggestion/advice/idea
to put forward a suggestion (to sb in a senior position)/to offer a word of advice
advice/to advise
good plan/good idea
excellent plan/brilliant scheme
Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)
to admonish
high merit and worthy prospects (idiom)
to discuss matters of vital importance
to encourage the free airing of views (idiom)
large scale program of lasting importance/project of paramount importance/to think big/annual national audit
to scheme/to plot/conspiracy
to share tribulations/to help sb with worries and difficulties
brocade sack of miracle plans (idiom); bag of tricks/fiendishly cunning masterplan (written out by strategic genius of fiction, and given to the local commander in a brocade bag)
